title: JoyTTS: LLM-based Spoken Chatbot With Voice Cloning
author: Fangru Zhou (JD Health International Inc.), Jun Zhao (JD Health International Inc.), Guoxin Wang (JD Health International Inc.), ...
relevance_why: The incorporation of voice cloning and the use of large language models (LLMs) in JoyTTS can directly influence Haohe Liu's work by providing innovative techniques in audio and speech synthesis, as well as applications in personalized voice interaction systems.
background: JoyTTS is a spoken chatbot that utilizes a combination of large language models and text-to-speech technology to create a chatbot capable of replicating human-like speech.
contribution: JoyTTS introduces a novel architecture that merges large language models with advanced text-to-speech technology, achieving high speaker similarity and low word error rates.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Earlier chatbot methods lacked voice cloning capabilities and were less efficient in generating natural speech.
technical_comparison.novelty: JoyTTS enhances the performance by integrating hidden layer features from the language model into the speech synthesis process, improving contextual understanding.

key_innovation: Utilizes hidden states from the language model to improve the naturalness and accuracy of speech generation in response to text inputs.
real_world_impact: The low latency in response time suggests significant potential for real-time applications in virtual assistants and interactive voice response systems.

new_terms.voice cloning: **Voice cloning** refers to the technology that enables the replication of a person’s voice, capturing nuances and tonal qualities to produce realistic speech.
new_terms.hidden states: **Hidden states** are internal representations generated by neural networks that capture the contextual information of input data, which are critical for tasks such as speech synthesis.

open_sourcing: The code and models, along with training and inference scripts, are available at https://github.com/jdh-algo/JoyTTS.git.
